hanzi-su-wiki:
窓

Значения

Окно

Мнемоника

  • Окно, отверстие 穴 в стене, где сидит, постоянно вздыхая 厶, жена. Сердцем 心 она с ушедшим из дому мужем.

  • "Давайте откроем окно вашего сердца 心."

Варианты

窗, 窻, 牎, 牕, 囪
purpleculture_pinyin:
chuāng
variant of 窗 [chuang1]
вариант окна [chuang1]
rtega_mnemonic:
窓窓RS
窗窗		window
  • like the opening 穴 in an individuals 厶 heart 心
  • ⓢ opening 穴 like a chimney 囱
heisig_constituent: window, hole, house, human legs, elbow, heart
koohiiStory1: The top primitive is similar to hole (#1316). A window is a hole (#1316) in your house that you occassionally sit next to while leaning on your ELBOW and gazing out, a picture of a lonely HEARTedness.
koohiiStory2: Anna stood inside the house 宀 on her human legs 儿 enjoying some private 厶 time, looking out the window and communing with the feelings that were in her heart 心. The first five strokes are actually 穴、あな, "hole," introduced later. 窓、まど, window; 窓口、まどぐち, ticket window; 車窓、しゃそう, car window.
kunYomi: まど、てんまど、けむだし
jp_example_words:
窓口(まどぐち): ticket window
窓(まど): window
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The hole leading to the private heart of your house is the window. Or maybe it's just the window to your soul, and not your house. Like the poetry people say.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine someone looking into a hole that shows your private heart. That's a window. A window you probably should have kept closed. Now everyone is looking in.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You realize that a ton of people are looking into your window and seeing all your private things. This makes you mad (まど)! What right do they have to know your private thoughts and desires?!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Look out your window back at the faces. Try to express how mad you are at them with your face through the glass. Make as many mad faces that you can think of.
Ru_Radicals: 儿 (ножки), 厶 (значок МУ), 宀 (значок У), 心 (сердце), 穴 (дыра)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hole (穴) in your private (厶) heart (心) is a window

窓字的基本解释

窓
chuāng
同“窗”。

窓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chuāng］
［《集韻》初江切，平江，初。］
亦作“牎1”。亦作“牕1”。“葱2”的被通假字。“囱1”的今字。亦作“窓1”。亦作“窻1”。亦作“1”。亦作“1”。
(1)设在屋顶或壁上用以透光通风的洞口。今一般装有窗扇。
(2)茶炉通风漏灰的洞。
[②]［cōng］
［《集韻》麤叢切，平東，清。］
亦作“牎2”。亦作“牕2”。
烟突；灶上烟囱。

窓字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【穴字部】　窓； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页865第12
【廣韻】俗窻字。

窓字的源字形

窓字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
窓

窓
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chuāng］
["Ji Yun" Chu Jiang Qi, Ping Jiang, Chu. ]
Also known as "牎1". Also known as "牕1". The false word for "onion 2". The present word for "Chamn 1". Also known as "窓1". Also known as "窻1". Also called "1". Also called "1".
(1) An opening on the roof or wall for light transmission and ventilation. Window sashes are generally installed today.
(2) A hole for ventilating and leaking ash from the tea stove.
[②]［cōng］
["Ji Yun" rough cut, Pingdong, Qing. ]
Also known as "牎2". Also known as "牕2".
Smoke bursts; the stove tops the chimney.
窓

[Guangyun] Vulgar characters.

窓

Значения

Окно

Мнемоника

  • Окно, отверстие 穴 в стене, где сидит, постоянно вздыхая 厶, жена. Сердцем 心 она с ушедшим из дому мужем.

  • "Давайте откроем окно вашего сердца 心."

Варианты

窗, 窻, 牎, 牕, 囪

Radicals: 穴, ム, 心  (hole, private, heart)
Meaning Mnemonic
The hole leading to the private heart of your house is the window. Or maybe it's just the window to your soul, and not your house. Like the poetry people say.
Imagine someone looking into a hole that shows your private heart. That's a window. A window you probably should have kept closed. Now everyone is looking in.
Reading Mnemonic
You realize that a ton of people are looking into your window and seeing all your private things. This makes you mad (まど)! What right do they have to know your private thoughts and desires?!
Look out your window back at the faces. Try to express how mad you are at them with your face through the glass. Make as many mad faces that you can think of.
